intro: Dioscorea gentryi, commonly known as Gentry's yam, is a member of the Dioscoreaceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a climbing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces tuberous roots that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
